result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn P. Benz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea & Sentencing hearing held January 13, 2016

15CF172, 15CM319, & 15TR3002 cases called at 10:56 pm. Defendant Glenn P. Benz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-resolution reached. Amended Criminal complaint addressed on 15CF172. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Preliminary hearing waived. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and dismisses and reads-in Counts 3 & 4, 15CM319 & 15TR3002. Statement by DA Blader. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 48 months Wisconsin State Prison to be served as: 18 months Initial Confinement and 30 months Extended Supervision. 57 days of credit for time served. CONDTIONS of ES: $3000.00 fine inclusive of costs, 36 mo DL Revocation, 36 mo IID-effective today, AODA and follow through, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Defendant is not to be on the premises of any bars, defendant is not to possess/ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by a treating physician. Terms of Agent. No Contact with B. & S. Decker as named in the complaint of 15CM319. Court finds the defendant not eligible for CIP but finds eligible for SAP. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

10:20 am case called. Defendant Glenn P. Benz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 03:05 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Glenn P. Benz
Current: W639 Apache Ct, Fremont, WI 54940 United States  (Effective: 08-20-2015)
Prior: W639 Apache Ct, Poy Sippi, WI 54967

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:27 p.m. Defendant Glenn P. Benz in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted. The court reads the complaint to the DE.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
